sub_fields.label: Advanced Options
sub_fields.instructions: Click here to open advanced controls that allow you to fine tune this part of your website. Most users will not need need these controls.

sub_fields.label: Reduced Bottom Spacing
sub_fields.name: reduced_bottom_spacing
sub_fields.instructions: Each content row places about 75 pixels of space above and below the content. This creates a nice amount space between content making it easy to read. However there may be times when two rows of content belong closer together. Click this box to remove the bottom spacing of this row, bringing it closer to the following row.

sub_fields.label: Custom CSS Classes
sub_fields.name: custom_css_classes
sub_fields.instructions: Advanced Option: Placing class names here (separated by a standard space) will assign them to to this section's container. This will allow you to easily target this section with custom CSS.

sub_fields.label: Image Width
sub_fields.name: image_width
sub_fields.instructions: Determines how the content area will be displayed, giving the image half the content area or just one third.

sub_fields.label: Custom CSS Classes
sub_fields.name: custom_css_classes
sub_fields.instructions: Advanced Option: Placing class names here (separated by a standard space) will assign them to to this section's container. This will allow you to easily target this section with custom CSS.

sub_fields.label: Top Content
sub_fields.name: top_content
sub_fields.instructions:
Content placed here will appear above the WYSIWYG blocks that you create below. If you only need one block of content, use this one. This one will stretch the whole width of the page no matter how many blocks you add below.

The blocks you add below will be the ones that create automatic columns.

sub_fields.label: Content Block(s)
sub_fields.name: content_blocks
sub_fields.instructions:
Add content blocks, as many as you like. Content blocks will automatically size and position themselves.
  • 1 Content Block will stretch full content area of screen
  • 2 Content Blocks will produce 50/50 (2 columns)
  • 3 Content Blocks will produce 33/33/33 (3 columns)
  • 4 Content Blocks will produce 25/25/25/24 (4 columns
After the forth box a new row will be created, maintaining the maximum 4 column layout.

sub_fields.label: Intro Text
sub_fields.name: related_posts_intro_text
sub_fields.instructions: Displayed above the listing of posts

sub_fields.label: How Many Posts to Display
sub_fields.name: how_many_posts_to_display
sub_fields.instructions: How many related posts should be displayed? This sets the maximum number of posts to display. If a number greater is entered than there are posts that meet the criteria, then the display will be limited to available posts. A minimum of 3 will be displayed as set by design and you can increase that number in increments of 3 (even rows in the site design).

sub_fields.label: Post Category
sub_fields.name: post_category
sub_fields.instructions: Choose the category(ies)of posts that should display here.

sub_fields.label: Post Tags
sub_fields.name: post_tags
sub_fields.instructions: Optional. You can further refine your related article display by choosing a tag that the posts must belong to.
